text: I got this for my 19 month old son who is just starting out with learning to draw. His Early Head Start teacher suggested something like this to me, and after overwhelmingly looking at all the many options available on Amazon, I finally went with this one. And I'm happy with my choice. And although I have not given it to him yet, because it is for Christmas, I did open it to test it out. It works great! And I love that it is colored! Also love the that it comes with a travel size one that I can bring with us too appointments and such to keep him occupied! It erases very easily! And I'm going to love this, cause no messy clean up, which is great, because I have OCD! Lol! Love this product! It also came with an insert to contact them on Facebook and get a free toy as a gift, so I did, and when I did, it was a bot that I was talking to at first. Then later that evening, I was contacted by a real person from this company. And they were so nice and friendly! We even just chatted about my son! So if you want to buy from a company that is going to actually communicate with you, this would be the one! They are so nice and friendly! Great service! And a great product!

review_data: Reviewed in the United States on June 25, 2021
name: Amazon Customer
title: Endless fun & beautiful creations possible!
text: I’ll have to remember to add a picture later, but I wanted to write this before I forget. I bought this for my 3 year old niece who was coming to stay with me for a few days from out-of-state while her parents took a trip with friends. I bought this the day before she arrived & as promised, it was delivered the very next day (for free too). My niece LOVED both of the magnadoodle things that came together! She really had a fun time with the magnets that are shapes. Ha the moment she started she asked how we were going to save all her pieces of art, so to appease her I took a pic of every single creation lol. She enjoyed this thing every day she visited & was so bummed she couldn’t take it home with her….until I showed her the travel sized one she could have! Ha boy was she excited about that. Her father (my brother) told me she’s played with extremely cheap ones before, but she never enjoyed them because they broke instantly & didn’t work right. He told me those were like $0.99 each though, so I’m not surprised. While it obviously is not recommended, I watched (& corrected) my niece slam the magnets or pen into the screen a good few times (while I cringed), yet each time it held up with zero damage. That was a pleasant surprise. I was originally torn between an old fashioned etcha sketch or one of these, but I was sold on the multi-colors aspect of this one. I highly recommend this item if you’re looking for some good ole non-electronic entertainment for young ones. Actually, I remember enjoying my etcha sketch until I was pretty old ha. This company is great to deal with as well. They offered 6 free stickers if I contacted on Facebook (the item came with one of the stickers & myself & the niece loved it, so I had to get the additional 6). I contacted them to see if they could mail them to my nieces address instead of mine & they had no problem with it. Thanks again to them for that & these sweet magnadoodles!!!! :)
